24.text: First in the spotlight tonight is the Emmerdale actor Liam Fox.

27.text: His specialist subject - Auf Wiedersehen, Pet.

43.text: And the actress Kimberley Nixon on Agatha Christie's Poirot novels.

60.text: Hello, and welcome to Celebrity Mastermind with me,

63.text: John Humphrys, and four people who may at this stage be wondering

67.text: why they said yes to being here tonight.

69.text: Risking their reputations in the hope of becoming a Celebrity Mastermind.

75.text: They don't get a fee, it goes to charity.

77.text: But they do get the chance of winning a glass trophy and the title.

81.text: And to do it they get 90 seconds of questions on their special subject,

84.text: and then two minutes on general knowledge.

86.text: So let's get on with it and ask our first contender to join us please.

692.text: it was less than two years.

700.text:
- From when I started cycling, yeah.

703.text: Exactly. And how come you realised, or who realised and how,

707.text: that you were going to be a brilliant cyclist?

710.text: I did a talent day at Loughborough University with Paralympics GB.

713.text: And I got identified there as having potential talent.

716.text: I had a choice of one sport to choose from cos

719.text: I was rubbish at everything else.

720.text: So it all worked out well in the end.

722.text: But cycling you can manage without any trouble?

725.text: It still comes with its challenges, you know?

728.text: Obviously 70K around the track with one arm is quite scary at times.

731.text:
- Trying to handle a bike. 
- Quite!

733.text: But I can compete with some of the best cyclists

735.text: in the country so I'm happy with that.
